reviews.review_msg: This class is absolutely ridiculous.  DO NOT TAKE IT ONLINE!!!! When you ask him a question he does not get back to you very quickly, sometimes it takes days to hear a response.  This class is very hard, it is not an introductary class like the title says.  If this class is not mandatory, do not take it.
Very good teacher.  Great personality, makes class fun and interesting.  Tests are very fair.  Will definately take another course with him.
this guy is just one of the nicest guys ull ever meet. he really cares about the students. holds extra tutorials even for just 5 ppl. he's a funny guy and makes u want to continue on in kines!

He's a very funny guy, he makes going to class actually interesting and has a great personality. Vineet gives good advice and he will hold extra study sessions outside of class before tests.  He actually makes an effort to learn your name.  However, he is kind of anal about cell phones in class, which is reasonable in his perspective.

Vineet is the most amazing teacher/TA i've ever had at SFU.  He takes the time to get to know his students and encourages interaction and good study habits without being too imposing.  Great sense of humour - I actually looked forward to 8:30 am friday labs!
No Comments
If you're an auditory learner avoid completely. He's a very intelligent person, however in terms of being a professor and efficiently communicating this information he's not great to say the least.
extremely difficult class, very dry material, boring lecture. Midterm/ final are fill in blank formats, you need to memorize A LOT of stuffs. Try to avoid him. btw, lab is fun!!!

Course material was great but he ruined it for me. Tests are based on specific and sometimes useless details while concepts are ignored. Lectures were useless--had to remake all the powerpoints myself. If you're taking his course, MEMORIZE EVERY THING ON THE WORD DOCUMENT NOTES.Labs for this course were pretty fun.

Mike is a stand up guy, however, I would not recommend taking this course with him. He's teaching style is very unique, he uses slides and printouts ONLY. He doesn't use a textbook, saves you money but it actually would've been useful to have one so I could've taught myself the material. Finals were extremely difficult, even for me.

worst teacher I've ever had. Do not take it with him, especially if deciding on as an elective. Notes are unorganized and don't really make sense. Only positive was you don't have to come to class as exams are word for word from the notes., which he emails out prior to class.

Michael is an excellent teacher, but is one of the type who gives you less than you need... meaning you will have to explore on your own, even out of the textbook for information that will be on midterms and finals. Great teacher nonetheless.
worst prof ever. Some of these comments seem like its him commenting. strongly advise staying away from him.

I found the material pretty boring and Walsh didn't help, if you skip a few it won't matter. Just read over the notes.The exams were a lot harder than expected. Since they're fill in the blank you have to memorize EVERYTHING. Labs were alright, but you really need to read over the lab manual for the quizzes.

His jokes are funny alrite, but that is the only thing i remember from his lectures. he would tell a bunch of jokes and then slightly touch on the course materials. BEWARE! REALLY HARD EXAMS! failed miserably on the midterms, and only barely passed the finals. if your gonna take kin142, take it other profs; this prof is bad at 142!

The course itself is pretty interesting, labs are great. Walsh...not so much. Emailing him for help was a waste of time, but the TA's for the course were some of the best TAs I've had. Midterm and Final exams were ridiculous, major concepts were missed while small rather unimportant details were required. Take the course, not with Walsh.

So this is supposed to be an easy class! This prof makes it incredibly hard!!! We must learn every little detail in his notes that comes up in the exams, even his TA's don't know that much detail!! The lab attendance is a must!He wont reply to your emails, and ALMOST EVERYONE barely passed and many failed this course. KEEP AWAY!!

He is a great prof that tells interesting stories about all kinds of subjects throughout the lecture to capture your attention. Although his exams are pretty tough, if you know his notes inside and out, you'll do fine.

Unprepared and does not use his own notes. His notes are copied and pasted into a powerpoint meanwhile lacking knowledge with using computers. He never fullscreens the powerpoint. Instead he spends most of the time scrolling up and down, trying to find the notes or diagram that he pasted into the powerpoint. He simply gets paid for doing nothing.

hes a really nice prof, and as long as you go to the lectures you'll be fine! he also manages to keep your attention with his tangents, which unlike other peoples tangents, are actually RELEVANT to what you're learning
TERRIBLE TEACHER WITH GOD COMPLEXION AND THINKS WHATEVER HE SAYS IS RIGHT.

Okay prof. His lectures aren't very interesting but you have to go because he draws a lot of diagrams and he tests on them. Midterm was very hard. Not all that helpful.. no textbook for this class so no way to reference. Annoying printed notes.
Must attend all classes. Diagrams which are not included in notes is all he tests on. Overall, not enthusiastic about teaching and always goes on about his love for his graduate students.

He never responds back about anything you email him about, as well as just races through our lectures without actually going over everything.  You MUST Copy down ALLLLLLL diagrams, 2/3 of them are on his tests
No Comments

He likes to tell a lot of stories (canoeing and football especially). Exams are straight from lecture notes and lectures are recorded. Lab exams are all from study questions. Marks are distributed well. He is a good prof, knowledgeable and willing to help. Definitely take a class with Craig.

Such an awesome prof! Likes to tell stories in class, and the content covered is pretty straight forward. Exams are based straight off lecture notes but know your stuff well since they're mostly theoretical questions. Anatomy exam for labs was difficult but do-able. I would take a course with Craig again :)

Craig knows what he's talking about, and everything he chooses to mention in class is explained well; the lectures, however, contain a small percent of what you need to know to succeed in the course.  Study the notes!  The Lab component can be a fair amount of work on a given week and the Anatomy exam is tacked onto the course without focus.

Craig's a good prof. His lectures are useless because he pretty much repeats the lecture notes and plus, they're recorded. He tells some pretty funny stories in lecture though. Labs can be fun too. Try to get Brent Flodin as your TA! He's super laid back and he's knowledgeable on the material and what's probably gonna be on the exams.

Really great professor. You can tell he's passionate about what he teaches. Exams are straight from his lecture notes and the study questions that he gives you. DON'T underestimate the course load though. Study, study study

He's so fun and nice! sometimes he gets off topic but seriously this is my fave class! the lec midterm was all from his notes and the lab midterm is all from the lab manual, i heard the questions are similar to study questions.

Lectures are really useless, but entertaining. He posts all notes online, in as much detail as you need to know for exams. Labs are very important, look at and learn all the info for study questions of each unit in your lab session, exam questions are pretty much straight from that.

Lecture exams are straight out of the notes and are predictable.The lab exams are EXACTLY like the study questions in the lab manual so make sure to find the answers to them as they're not all in the manual.He talks about unrelated stuff A LOT some enjoy it some find it a waste of time.Attendance is not mandatory

Great prof! Very funny and engaging during lectures...actually makes you wanna go. He does get a bit off topic talking about his vacations and family or the SFU football team, but that gives your brain a break for 5 minutes which is nice. All the lectures are posted online which helps a lot as well. Helpful during office hours as well.
Really good prof, lectures not mandatory due to all notes being online. I recommend this prof, very engaging
Clearly knows what he is talking about, and isn't going to pretend otherwise. Entertaining and interesting.
Awesome professor. Loved his class. Just one of those classes where you're more interested in learning the material rather than simply getting the grade.
So funny, and his pictures make lectures interesting
He's a treat! His stories will make your life so much better.. Very interesting class:)

This is a very straight-forward class. The only thing that makes it difficult the amount of information you have to remember, but it is all right from his notes. His classes are interesting and he tells good stories to accompany the topics we are learning. A really amazing prof and course.
Asmundson is the best prof ever. hes a pretty cule guy.

Craig is a great guy. He is a good teacher, who is very approachable. He tells some pretty good stories during class too. Also, his exams com purely from his notes, which are online. I stopped taking notes in class, I just listened. The only negative thing about the lectures is that the tend to drag on. My class felt much longer than the 50 minutes
Craig is an excellent teacher.  He's pretty funny, makes lectures interesting.  The only complaint I would have is how much memorization you have to do in this class.

Leah was fantastic. She was easy to approach and took time to re-explain concepts. She was the Lab TA for KIN 142, and was so much fun! Her suggestion to buy the Anatomy Colouring book is a VERY good one, especially for visual learners. Her Lab was very well correlated with lectures.

Super good prof!! He's constantly straightforward, lays down everything you need to know! All the topics he tests on exams come from his lecture notes and nothing else, so you have no reason to panic except memorize, memorize, memorize. He also makes lectures enjoyable and ensures people know what they're learning! You MUST put in the effort.
Great prof! Best class ive taken so far. To get a good mark you have to put the work in... He is straight-up and tests are extreamly FAIR. 10/10

Great professor, he has a great interest in what he is teaching which in turn rubs off on students. His lectures are engaging he adds adventure stories about his life which gives the topics a real life perspective. The exams were straightforward, I would recommend knowing everything thing on the lecture noted especially things you can list.

Very hard course, because you gotta study you a__ off if you want to pass. I did just that and escaped with a "B". However, you do learn a lot, and I recommend it to hard working students. I don't recommend it as a credit course.
GREAT professor! oneof the best ever, super helpful andinteresting, really knows his stuff, with fair (but hard) tests
Good Prof. Learned loads. Tests are very fair, not bad. Study a lot for the lab midterm and final though

Good prof.Knows his stuff.One piece of advice that will get you the good grade is, DO YOUR LAB QUESTIONS as you do your labs instead of at the end because they are on the exam and they are time consuming b/c the answers are not all in the notes and text book! Keep up with the lecture notes or just memorize them inside out!

Please avoid the Dist Ed version of this course if you can....  what a nightmare.  I believe about 30% of the students in KIN 142 DE failed the class.  The grade was much lower than I expected.  I should have taken a different DE Sci elective instead.
Great course. Asmundson is enthusiastic about what he teaches and is clear in delivering his message.
Don't take this course unless you're prepared to study your brains out! Its like biology AP multiplied by 3! Alot of work...

Pretty easy class.  If you're a kin major and have a good memory you can probably get away with studyign 3 days before and get an A.  Everything you need to know is in online notes, although I recommend doing/getting off someone the study questions.

Good prof, you can tell he loves what he does. His notes were great to have. Lecture material is pretty straight froward and his stories make class interesting. However, I found exams difficult, especially the lab material. Labs were ok, would've been better with a more helpful TA.

his anecdotes kept you awake and his notes are super clear and easy to understand. the tests are staightforward and right out of his notes. REALLY interesting class, though labs are a little tedious. awesome prof!!
good prof; very interested in the subject matter.  exams though have lots of memorizing to do
This course was sooo good topped off by an even better prof. His passion for kin reflects in everything he does and it will make you like kin too.
No Comments

Tests come from the notes he gives which are more than enough. DO NOT BUY THE TEXT it is useless as the lab manual and lecture notes are very good. I really enjoyed his lectures. His stories are usually pretty funny. If you are taking this course, the stories and pictures usually help to keep you from becoming bored.

his passion for kinesiology and sense of humor makes the class great. u really dont need the textbook; his notes are enough. and i actually like his stories and pictures..makes the class interesting:)
No Comments
I thought his notes were well done. Don't buy the text book, you dont need it. His lectures were okay. I wouldnt mind having him again for another class.
I always fall asleep during his lectures since they are so boring! Labs are not bad.

Simple course and easygoing prof... nothing gets easier than studying for his tests because everything he will ever ask is in his online notes so it's not a guessing game like some other classes.  Lectures are not mandatory but he does have alot of interesting things to say (mostly about camping and his grandchildren though:P) Labs are harder...
The course is very straightforward. THe prof is good at presenting all his materials. NOt boring at all.
Lectures were ok...just studying from his online notes. The textbook is not needed. Labs are really fun, especially with Vineet. A lot of work is needed, but it can be done. Great class!
No Comments

This class was fun, but the exams were hard! You have to memorize all the lecture notes and lab manual. Craig is funny but always brings up camping trips or his grandson in lectures..lol. Fun class, but a lot of work (ps. TA Evan is a hard marker, watch out!)

You don't have to attend lectures. He basically reads off his notes. Just memorize ALL the notes then you will be fine. The labs are fun to do, but the review questions have no answers. This class is about memorization and research.

this is a hard course with lots of material. he talks a lot about things that have only slight relevance to the topic at hand, but notes ARE online, but you'll need to memorized ALL of them for the tests...

The professor is difficult to hear because he either talks too softly, or he mumbles.  He has been teaching the course for some time now, and his enthusiasm for teaching it is waning.  The course notes are not clear unless you attend class.

Textbook? What textbook? With this prof, you didn't need one. Notes are crystal clear and extremely helpful. The course covers a lot of material, so be prepared to study your brains out, but if you like human physiology, this is for you.

Funny and interesting lectures. Very helpful in office hours, and even helps out in labs sometimes. At the end of the last lecture, everyone in the class stood up and started applauding. hah! if that doesn't mean great, nothing does.

Good lecture, boring course. If you want to get an A, you'll have to practically memorize every single term and detail from his lecture notes. Although 80% is A-, this course is NOT easy credit, don't take it unless you are prepared to study like a freak.
Boring, can't really hear him. He mumbles too much. The light is too dim, and his notes are hard to follow. Marking style differs from Bio.

This course was very difficult. The prof was okay, tended to speak very casually so it was hard to tell what material was important. The final exam is worth 55%, all handwritten, and difficult. The marking (%) balance is set up poorly. For kin.major only.
Cool prof... hilarious.... esp. w/ all his stories about his family lol.. makes his notes clearer.
He's a good professor.  Printed notes are thorough if somewhat wordy, and he tends to spend a lot of time on his vacation pictures.  Overall a good prof though.
Awesome prof. Makes courses interesting. Highly recommended if your taking 142
A great guy.  Understanding and willing to help you learn.  We need more profs like him around.
Great prof..however, talks about his prostate surgery too much
What a great guy!  Once you get used to his sarcasm, he's hilarious!!!
awesome prof! take 142 with him!
No Comments
No Comments
Very easy professor, cares about the material he teaches, ensures his students understand material, and goes out of his way to explain content in-dept for students who ask for help.
Greatest TA at SFU ! Take him if you can, you will find yourself a new favorite TA in university
Absolutely amazing! Have no other words to say!

If you get Brent as a ta, consider yourself blessed. I'm waiting for different semesters when he is a TA for some courses I want to take, just so I can try and take it with him. He's simply amazing. No other words to say.
The best TA I've had. If you're taking KIN142 he'll make it interesting and easy.
super helpful, really knows what he's talking about!
So GREAT! So HELPFUL! Always provided lots of feedback. Very easy to approach!
One of the best TA's ever!

Excellent teaching skills. I had him for kin 142 and he was very engaging, energetic and informative. There were many occasions where I was surprised by the amount of extra feedback he offered on charts/lab reports etc. Overall it was an awesome experience
BEST.
Oh my gosh..he is so awesome. Beyond words!
Mr. Awsome
TA for kin142..really funny and helpful!
Awesome guy. One of the most helpful and encouraging people I've ever met. I didn't find him difficult to understand. He has a bit of an accent, but his English is very good.

Lectures are fill in the black, so you have to show up. Isnt very clear due to language barrier, but seems to really want to help. Midterm and Final prep was good, but exams still turned out to be very difficult.

Tony is a very enthusiastic prof and extremely athletic. He's a good runner and he loves  what he does. I would suggest actually taking the class (rather than taking it by distance) because the tutorials are a great way to learn new types of exercises.
She's a bit touchy with people talking througout lecture, she kicked a few people out for it.
Really good prof he seems passionate about kinesiology and makes lectures interesting, but the class itself is pretty hard, a lot of memorization
My favourite prof this semester. All exams are super fair if you put a bit of effort into studying!
very good prof. midterms and final was super fair. if you study all his lecture notes you should easily get an A. but prepare to work hard. would recommend this prof

This class is not a good choice for a gpa booster as it is a heavy course and requires commitment. However Jim is a good prof and makes class interesting and is very knowledgeable. Exams are all pretty fair as you know what to expect for the lab exams.  Final exam was pretty easy (I think). A solid choice.

THIS PROF WAS AWESOME. He had lecture notes ready for us (for this term, not sure about the future). His lectures were based on lecture notes, of course. But on top of that, he gave us extra details and visuals just to make sure we understood concepts better (which was GREAT and SO helpful). I would literally take any class he teaches.

Jim was a great guy, super clear. His exams are easy if you study a bit. He did fill in the blanks for the lecture midterm and final, which were usually pretty easy, with a few tricky ones. The lab material is really closely related to the lecture material, so by studying for one its pretty easy to double up and study for both. Highly recommended!!

This was his first time teaching this course and he was really interesting to listen to!  After a while, I stopped attending class when I realised everything that I had to know was straight from the notes.  His midterms were easy and final was somewhat challenging because every detail had to be known from the notes - such as exact values.
he is a great prof. He gives lots of examples when lecturing and his exams are pure memorization. You must attend the labs in order to do well in this course!
